result.execSummary:
The defendant Randall L Sitowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

dated 4/18/16 filed by Attorney Cotton regarding report date

Denied by Judge Maxwell 4/20/16.  Attorney Cotton's office advised of denial on 4/21/16.
Sentencing hearing at 04-15-2016 09:30 am

Defendant Randall L Sitowski in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing hearing. Parties address the request to have the letter from the ex-wife sealed.  Defense counsel is requesting adjournment to further investigate the request to having the letter sealed. Court grants.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 15, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Filed by State with enclosure from ex-wife of the defendant.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Randall L Sitowski in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to the charges in the Amended Information. Defense is requesting a separate sentencing date. Court grants.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
